p: The current outbreak of the novel 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) emerged in China in December 2019 and subsequently spread to many other countries. On January 30 2020, the Emergency Committee of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared a global health emergency, and less than one month later, almost 80,000 cases were confirmed in China and more than 7,000 cases outside of China. Numerous countries have reported increasing numbers of confirmed cases and deaths per day, and despite all efforts, spreading of COVID-19 currently continues; therefore, on March 11 2020, the WHO declared COVID-19 a pandemic ( WHO, 2020a).
